channel.title: Project Shift
channel.description:
[img]http://xs216.xs.to/xs216/07254/ad.png[/img]
We are looking for experienced coders with an adequate understanding for the programming language Java. Our goal is to develop a private server for RS2, that is completely identical to how it was near June 2006, before it was heavily changed.
You may have heard of us before, with our first line of servers that are now obsolete. This new server we are developing is called 'Shift'. Shift has it's own functions for SQL and we have the basic loading and saving player data already completed. It is based off of a WhiteScape 3.2, and uses packages instead of the normal servers. We have removed all of the WhiteScape content, which includes, Skills, Packets, and a large amount of other things that were not needed and will be rewritten.
We are currently working on the Content part of our development, and have the basic layout of the server mapped out as for built in functions. We have also developed, but yet untested, a sublanguage with a Java backend called 'ReenScript', to also mimic what RS2 has. We have not gone deep into testing but it has a basic functionality and code layout.
We do not accept beginner coders, as you will see in the format sticky, we require you to post an example of a work you have done. Be sure to make it your best, because we go with what we see.
We operate a few websites under our belt, we have the main game website at http://reenscape.org, and we have a second RuneHQ-like site at http://reenscape.info. If you are interested in our web development branch, those are our main sites that we would put you under.
Knowledge required:
[ul][li]An adequate knowledge of Java.[/li][li]Atleast some experience playing RS2.[/li][li]If you are interested in developing web-based tools for us, you will need knowledge of PHP and MySQL.[/li][li]Understanding code conventions and code logic, as well as efficiency.[/li][li]Experience with Java package naming.[/li][/ul]
[b]To apply for our team, please make a topic in our Recruitment forum, which can be located here: http://forums.reenscapeshift.com/index.php?board=63.0 [/b]
[i]Note to moderation team, I am sorry for having the above link, but there are too many forums that we will have this topic in to keep track of all at once, a central recruitment forum is the best thing to do in this scenario.[/i]

item.title: Project Shift
item.dc:creator: @Shift Shift
item.description:
@Shift wrote:

boomer216:

<3 Shift <3 Reen, Good Luck Jim(?) I am guessing…

Illegal Socks:

Will there be skill capes or fire capes that are moving or fully working fight pit or cw anything that most servers dont have? I’m sure you could accomplish it because you have lots of people helping you!

We aren’t settling for shit, so everything on that list minus skill capes we plan to accomplish.
I didn’t mention this but, we’re going for the full thing, as much as possible. It’s very easy coding on this server, so it’s not like any of the servers that have previously been out.[br]

Read full topic

item.title: Project Shift
item.dc:creator: @Shift Shift
item.description:
@Shift wrote:

getsome:

lol are those the skill classes from runescape itself ? or is it coded stuff by you

Those are the javadocs…Basically all of the classes and the child variables/methods of those classes that are currently in the server. So obviously your answer would be stuff coded by us :P.

Read full topic

Proof, http://docs.reenscapeshift.com/ .

item.description:

item.title: Project Shift
item.dc:creator: @Shift Shift
item.description:
@Shift wrote:

[quote=“Illegal Socks, post:7, topic:114685”]Wow i just saw website now it looks awesome!! I wish you good luck on server ;D

Sorry if this is too much to ask for but when you create the server is there any chance i could be mod? I understand if you say no :|[/quote]

For anyone interested in the website’s features:

[ul][li]News loads from SQL on index page[/li][li]Fully working news archives[/li][li]Fully working poll (Solved their percentage formula :P)[/li][li]Forums (Down at the moment… In the progress of a recode)[/li][li]Login system fully working with password change[/li][li]Fully working knowledgebase with SQL[/li][li]Player data stored in SQL, so the site can also access it if needed.[/li][/ul]

Read full topic
